intro: Argolasia lanata, commonly known as the hairy argolasia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical forests. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
